00049 /*****************************************************************************
00050  *
00051  * Lov lock operations.
00052  *
00053  */
00054 
00055 static struct lov_sublock_env *lov_sublock_env_get(const struct lu_env *env,
00056                                                    const struct cl_lock *parent,
00057                                                    struct lov_lock_sub *lls)
00058 {
00059         struct lov_sublock_env *subenv;
00060         struct lov_io          *lio    = lov_env_io(env);
00061         struct cl_io           *io     = lio->lis_cl.cis_io;
00062         struct lov_io_sub      *sub;
00063 
00064         subenv = &lov_env_session(env)->ls_subenv;
00065 
00066         /*
00067          * FIXME: We tend to use the subio's env & io to call the sublock
00068          * lock operations because osc lock sometimes stores some control
00069          * variables in thread's IO infomation(Now only lockless information).
00070          * However, if the lock's host(object) is different from the object
00071          * for current IO, we have no way to get the subenv and subio because
00072          * they are not initialized at all. As a temp fix, in this case,
00073          * we still borrow the parent's env to call sublock operations.
00074          */
00075         if (!io || !cl_object_same(io->ci_obj, parent->cll_descr.cld_obj)) {
00076                 subenv->lse_env = env;
00077                 subenv->lse_io  = io;
00078                 subenv->lse_sub = NULL;
00079         } else {
00080                 sub = lov_sub_get(env, lio, lls->sub_stripe);
00081                 if (!IS_ERR(sub)) {
00082                         subenv->lse_env = sub->sub_env;
00083                         subenv->lse_io  = sub->sub_io;
00084                         subenv->lse_sub = sub;
00085                 } else {
00086                         subenv = (void*)sub;
00087                 }
00088         }
00089         return subenv;
00090 }
00091 
00092 static void lov_sublock_env_put(struct lov_sublock_env *subenv)
00093 {
00094         if (subenv && subenv->lse_sub)
00095                 lov_sub_put(subenv->lse_sub);
00096 }
00097 
00098 static int lov_sublock_init(const struct lu_env *env,
00099                             const struct cl_lock *parent,
00100                             struct lov_lock_sub *lls)
00101 {
00102         struct lov_sublock_env *subenv;
00103         int result;
00104         ENTRY;
00105 
00106         subenv = lov_sublock_env_get(env, parent, lls);
00107         if (!IS_ERR(subenv)) {
00108                 result = cl_lock_init(subenv->lse_env, &lls->sub_lock,
00109                                       subenv->lse_io);
00110                 lov_sublock_env_put(subenv);
00111         } else {
00112                 /* error occurs. */
00113                 result = PTR_ERR(subenv);
00114         }
00115         RETURN(result);
00116 }
00117 
00126 static struct lov_lock *lov_lock_sub_init(const struct lu_env *env,
00127                                           const struct cl_object *obj,
00128                                           struct cl_lock *lock)
00129 {
00130         int result = 0;
00131         int i;
00132         int nr;
00133         loff_t start;
00134         loff_t end;
00135         loff_t file_start;
00136         loff_t file_end;
00137 
00138         struct lov_object       *loo    = cl2lov(obj);
00139         struct lov_layout_raid0 *r0     = lov_r0(loo);
00140         struct lov_lock         *lovlck;
00141 
00142         ENTRY;
00143 
00144         file_start = cl_offset(lov2cl(loo), lock->cll_descr.cld_start);
00145         file_end   = cl_offset(lov2cl(loo), lock->cll_descr.cld_end + 1) - 1;
00146 
00147         for (i = 0, nr = 0; i < r0->lo_nr; i++) {
00148                 /*
00149                  * XXX for wide striping smarter algorithm is desirable,
00150                  * breaking out of the loop, early.
00151                  */
00152                 if (likely(r0->lo_sub[i] != NULL) && /* spare layout */
00153                     lov_stripe_intersects(loo->lo_lsm, i,
00154                                           file_start, file_end, &start, &end))
00155                         nr++;
00156         }
00157         LASSERT(nr > 0);
00158 
00159         OBD_ALLOC_LARGE(lovlck, offsetof(struct lov_lock, lls_sub[nr]));
00160         if (lovlck == NULL)
00161                 RETURN(ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM));
00162 
00163         lovlck->lls_nr = nr;
00164         for (i = 0, nr = 0; i < r0->lo_nr; ++i) {
00165                 if (likely(r0->lo_sub[i] != NULL) &&
00166                     lov_stripe_intersects(loo->lo_lsm, i,
00167                                           file_start, file_end, &start, &end)) {
00168                         struct lov_lock_sub *lls = &lovlck->lls_sub[nr];
00169                         struct cl_lock_descr *descr;
00170 
00171                         descr = &lls->sub_lock.cll_descr;
00172 
00173                         LASSERT(descr->cld_obj == NULL);
00174                         descr->cld_obj   = lovsub2cl(r0->lo_sub[i]);
00175                         descr->cld_start = cl_index(descr->cld_obj, start);
00176                         descr->cld_end   = cl_index(descr->cld_obj, end);
00177                         descr->cld_mode  = lock->cll_descr.cld_mode;
00178                         descr->cld_gid   = lock->cll_descr.cld_gid;
00179                         descr->cld_enq_flags = lock->cll_descr.cld_enq_flags;
00180 
00181                         lls->sub_stripe = i;
00182 
00183                         /* initialize sub lock */
00184                         result = lov_sublock_init(env, lock, lls);
00185                         if (result < 0)
00186                                 break;
00187 
00188                         lls->sub_initialized = 1;
00189                         nr++;
00190                 }
00191         }
00192         LASSERT(ergo(result == 0, nr == lovlck->lls_nr));
00193 
00194         if (result != 0) {
00195                 for (i = 0; i < nr; ++i) {
00196                         if (!lovlck->lls_sub[i].sub_initialized)
00197                                 break;
00198 
00199                         cl_lock_fini(env, &lovlck->lls_sub[i].sub_lock);
00200                 }
00201 
00202                 OBD_FREE_LARGE(lovlck,
00203                                 offsetof(struct lov_lock, lls_sub[nr]));
00204                 lovlck = ERR_PTR(result);
00205         }
00206 
00207         RETURN(lovlck);
00208 }
00209 
00210 static void lov_lock_fini(const struct lu_env *env,
00211                           struct cl_lock_slice *slice)
00212 {
00213         struct lov_lock *lovlck;
00214         int i;
00215 
00216         ENTRY;
00217         lovlck = cl2lov_lock(slice);
00218         for (i = 0; i < lovlck->lls_nr; ++i) {
00219                 LASSERT(!lovlck->lls_sub[i].sub_is_enqueued);
00220                 if (lovlck->lls_sub[i].sub_initialized)
00221                         cl_lock_fini(env, &lovlck->lls_sub[i].sub_lock);
00222         }
00223         OBD_FREE_LARGE(lovlck,
00224                        offsetof(struct lov_lock, lls_sub[lovlck->lls_nr]));
00225         EXIT;
00226 }
00227 
00235 static int lov_lock_enqueue(const struct lu_env *env,
00236                             const struct cl_lock_slice *slice,
00237                             struct cl_io *io, struct cl_sync_io *anchor)
00238 {
00239         struct cl_lock          *lock   = slice->cls_lock;
00240         struct lov_lock         *lovlck = cl2lov_lock(slice);
00241         int                     i;
00242         int                     rc      = 0;
00243 
00244         ENTRY;
00245 
00246         for (i = 0; i < lovlck->lls_nr; ++i) {
00247                 struct lov_lock_sub     *lls = &lovlck->lls_sub[i];
00248                 struct lov_sublock_env  *subenv;
00249 
00250                 subenv = lov_sublock_env_get(env, lock, lls);
00251                 if (IS_ERR(subenv)) {
00252                         rc = PTR_ERR(subenv);
00253                         break;
00254                 }
00255 
00256                 rc = cl_lock_enqueue(subenv->lse_env, subenv->lse_io,
00257                                      &lls->sub_lock, anchor);
00258                 lov_sublock_env_put(subenv);
00259                 if (rc != 0)
00260                         break;
00261 
00262                 lls->sub_is_enqueued = 1;
00263         }
00264         RETURN(rc);
00265 }
00266 
00267 static void lov_lock_cancel(const struct lu_env *env,
00268                             const struct cl_lock_slice *slice)
00269 {
00270         struct cl_lock  *lock   = slice->cls_lock;
00271         struct lov_lock *lovlck = cl2lov_lock(slice);
00272         int i;
00273 
00274         ENTRY;
00275 
00276         for (i = 0; i < lovlck->lls_nr; ++i) {
00277                 struct lov_lock_sub     *lls = &lovlck->lls_sub[i];
00278                 struct cl_lock          *sublock = &lls->sub_lock;
00279                 struct lov_sublock_env  *subenv;
00280 
00281                 if (!lls->sub_is_enqueued)
00282                         continue;
00283 
00284                 lls->sub_is_enqueued = 0;
00285                 subenv = lov_sublock_env_get(env, lock, lls);
00286                 if (!IS_ERR(subenv)) {
00287                         cl_lock_cancel(subenv->lse_env, sublock);
00288                         lov_sublock_env_put(subenv);
00289                 } else {
00290                         CL_LOCK_DEBUG(D_ERROR, env, slice->cls_lock,
00291                                       "lov_lock_cancel fails with %ld.\n",
00292                                       PTR_ERR(subenv));
00293                 }
00294         }
00295 }
00296 
00297 static int lov_lock_print(const struct lu_env *env, void *cookie,
00298                           lu_printer_t p, const struct cl_lock_slice *slice)
00299 {
00300         struct lov_lock *lck = cl2lov_lock(slice);
00301         int              i;
00302 
00303         (*p)(env, cookie, "%d\n", lck->lls_nr);
00304         for (i = 0; i < lck->lls_nr; ++i) {
00305                 struct lov_lock_sub *sub;
00306 
00307                 sub = &lck->lls_sub[i];
00308                 (*p)(env, cookie, "    %d %x: ", i, sub->sub_is_enqueued);
00309                 cl_lock_print(env, cookie, p, &sub->sub_lock);
00310         }
00311         return 0;
00312 }
00313 
00314 static const struct cl_lock_operations lov_lock_ops = {
00315         .clo_fini      = lov_lock_fini,
00316         .clo_enqueue   = lov_lock_enqueue,
00317         .clo_cancel    = lov_lock_cancel,
00318         .clo_print     = lov_lock_print
00319 };
00320 
00321 int lov_lock_init_raid0(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_object *obj,
00322                         struct cl_lock *lock, const struct cl_io *io)
00323 {
00324         struct lov_lock *lck;
00325         int result = 0;
00326 
00327         ENTRY;
00328         lck = lov_lock_sub_init(env, obj, lock);
00329         if (!IS_ERR(lck))
00330                 cl_lock_slice_add(lock, &lck->lls_cl, obj, &lov_lock_ops);
00331         else
00332                 result = PTR_ERR(lck);
00333         RETURN(result);
00334 }
00335 
00336 static void lov_empty_lock_fini(const struct lu_env *env,
00337                                 struct cl_lock_slice *slice)
00338 {
00339         struct lov_lock *lck = cl2lov_lock(slice);
00340         OBD_SLAB_FREE_PTR(lck, lov_lock_kmem);
00341 }
00342 
00343 static int lov_empty_lock_print(const struct lu_env *env, void *cookie,
00344                         lu_printer_t p, const struct cl_lock_slice *slice)
00345 {
00346         (*p)(env, cookie, "empty\n");
00347         return 0;
00348 }
00349 
00350 /* XXX: more methods will be added later. */
00351 static const struct cl_lock_operations lov_empty_lock_ops = {
00352         .clo_fini  = lov_empty_lock_fini,
00353         .clo_print = lov_empty_lock_print
00354 };
00355 
00356 int lov_lock_init_empty(const struct lu_env *env, struct cl_object *obj,
00357                         struct cl_lock *lock, const struct cl_io *io)
00358 {
00359         struct lov_lock *lck;
00360         int result = -ENOMEM;
00361 
00362         ENTRY;
00363         OBD_SLAB_ALLOC_PTR_GFP(lck, lov_lock_kmem, GFP_NOFS);
00364         if (lck != NULL) {
00365                 cl_lock_slice_add(lock, &lck->lls_cl, obj, &lov_empty_lock_ops);
00366                 result = 0;
00367         }
00368         RETURN(result);
00369 }
